page.title: 06Recreation
page.content: Ramblers and walkers use the North Downs Way leading to Chilham and Canterbury. There are many public footpaths. The Wye Footpath Preservation Society exists to maintain these ancient rights of way and organises walks along the paths. Individuals use them too, often to exercise their dogs. Sponsored walks combine useful exercise with financial benefit for charity. Bridleways are used by horseriders so they often get very muddy. There is coarse fishing on the River Stour by permission of the appropriate landowner. In winter there is pheasant and partridge shooting,foxhunting with the East Kent and beagling with the Wye College pack.
